timeline.bodyText:
Please do not add these suppress warnings.
If you use Idea, you can suppress warnings for methods/classes annotated with a specific annotation (such as GET, PUT etc.), so this is not marked as a problem. I hope other IDEs have similar way of getting around it.
Suppress warnings in source code should be used for compiler warnings (such as generics) and warnings that are significant (e.g. the warning is sound, but we have a good reason to ignore it).
This case is neither
timeline.author: tomas-langer

replies.bodyText: Removed. (These are present in other examples which I borrowed from. All should be cleaned up then.)
replies.author: tjquinno

timeline.bodyText:
Please use Hamcrest assertions.
All Helidon tests should be written using Hamcrest (there are a few exceptions such as fail and assertAll) - see dev guidelines.
This should be
assertThat("HTTP response1", r.status().code(), is(200));
This is an overall problem in all the tests.
timeline.author: tomas-langer

replies.bodyText: Done. (We should bring all examples into line with this so there are no misleading patterns around people might follow.)
replies.author: tjquinno
